headline: DanDan's Strawberry Cream Pie
description: This light-as-air pie has sweetened cream cheese, fresh whipped cream, and plenty of strawberries piled high on a graham cracker crust.
name: DanDan's Strawberry Cream Pie

recipeInstructions.text: Mix cream cheese, white sugar, and vanilla extract in a large bowl until smooth. Stir 3/4 cup mashed strawberries into cream cheese mixture.

Beat heavy cream and confectioners' sugar in a glass or metal bowl until stiff peaks form. Lift your beater or whisk straight up: the cream will form sharp peaks. Fold whipped cream into cream cheese mixture until evenly mixed; fold in remaining 1/4 cup sliced strawberries.
Spoon strawberry mixture into graham cracker crust. Chill at least 3 hours before serving.

review.reviewBody: OMG !!! Family and co-workers went ga-ga over it !!!! Going to try it with local/fresh peaches !!! Thank you ever so much !!!

I haven't made the recipe yet, but I wonder if making stabilized whipped cream would help it to firm up. Homemade whipped topping is great, but it tends to liquefy quicker. https://www.errenskitchen.com/how-to-make-whipped-cream-that-holds-its-shape-for-days/ I am going to try to make for a Nursing Home strawberry recipe contest for the residents to judge. I may just try Cool Whip, though I do love homemade whipped cream!

The pie tasted wonderful, but it did not set even overnite. I have made it twice and followed the recipe with same results both times. Will try adding cornstarch next time to see if that helps . Tastes delicious!
Sooooo Good! I did substitute the fresh strawberries for the frozen ones in syrup from rouses (thawed and strained) and this is by far my favorite dessert ever!
Super easy and tastes great

I've now made this pie many times, and the key is that you must use fresh strawberries, never frozen. Everyone always loves it. My favorite way to do it is to decorate the top all over with fresh strawberries and place a sprig of fresh mint in the middle. So yummy! I am seriously debating trying this with other fruits, like blueberries for instance. Will return to let you know how it works out!

This was delicious with a chocolate wafer crust. I made individual servings in mini mason jars and everyone loved them. I increased the amount of crushed strawberries and eliminated the sugar in the heavy cream.
While it was absolutely delicious, it did not set up properly. I had to put it in the freezer. I would love to know what was wrong.
This is the best strawberry pie we've ever had. I also made this with blueberries.

My family loved this pie. I'm making it again today! I used a regular pre-made pastry crust. I had some unsweetened freeze dried strawberries from Trader Joe's that I mixed into cream cheese with the crushed strawberries. Extra burst of flavor! Thinking of trying with marscapone cheese as substitute for cream cheese.

I love this recipe!! My mom used to make a similar pie with canned blueberries on top. It’s great with the fruit mixed in or not. I like to add fresh berry compote on top. I’ve also made the crust with shortbread cookies instead of graham cracker. It’s a really great dessert!
Ive made this so many times but I have found that it never firms up so I mix half a pudding packet into the final mix and I also use an oreo crust ???? I do love this recipe so so much
I will definitely make this again. It was a great hit in my home. I can't wait to make it for others as well. So delicious. Thank you for sharing!
My husband loves when I make this pie and he is not a fan of strawberries. I make a crust out of Nilla Wafer cookies instead of graham cracker.
Topped it with melted chocolate
My whole family loved it! Nothing left!

This pie turned out so delicious and creamy! I followed everyone's suggestions to drain some of the strawberry mash and in the middle I added a layer of slides strawberries so it looks like a layered cake. I also made extra cream and mashed strawberries to make a layer of tangy strawberry flavor on top.

It's the easiest cream pie n the most delicious compared to pies that call for adding jello or gelatin. This recipe tastes the freshest. The only things I do different is add more reg n powdered sugar since it wasn't sweet enough for my taste n i prefer a regular pie crust.

Great recipe but I found the cream cheese taste not quite what I wanted. I think if I double the mashed strawberries it will give more berry flavour. Directions were spot on and easy to make. Will make again and play to boost it to 5 stars
I baked the pie using a pastry crust. It baked nicely and held up nicely for the few days it lasted. The filling was very good but could have been a bit sweeter.

Two great things about this recipe. 1. You can substitute other fruits/flavors for the strawberries. 2. It only calls for about a cup of strawberries. I can’t tell you how many times I have fruit I need to use because it’s getting a little old, yet don’t have enough to make a straight fruit pie. This will be one of my go to recipes. Thank you!
SO SO GOOD! I definitely recommend extra strawberries and a chocolate drizzle to fancy things up!! Thanks Rhonda!
Very good! I drained mashed strawberries as someone suggested as to help filling set better. Turned out fantastic. Great fresh strawberry taste. Used shortbread crust.
Great pie! Easy recipe to substitute ingredients for those with dietary needs.
Made as printed. This tasted very good but did not firm up.

This pie is amazing! I've made it twice in two days, one for a church event, and one for home to be greedy with. Added extra strawberries to the batch, bout a cup and a half worth, rather than garnishing. Everyone loved it! The worst part of this recipe is waiting for it to chill. Barely made it long enough! Yum!

I didn't have heavy whipping cream. So instead I used homemade vanilla pudding and whipped it into the cream cheese and vanilla, adding sugar as needed. I used about 3Tbsp vanilla and added fresh peaches. Used the mini graham pie crusts and it was divine!

I used 1/3 less fat cream cheese, doubled the strawberries and 'healthy n fit' whipped cream. It was awesome! I also just made a version subbing fresh blueberries for the strawberries, as blueberries are now in season. Next I'm trying a red, white n blue version---using both blueberries n strawberries!
I substituted a container of Cool whip for the whipping cream steps. Was done in 10 mins. instead of adding the strawberries into the batter I put them on top.
Perfect recipe for little hands to help with!
Subbed strawberries with bananas, topped with toasted coconut.

Tasted really good however the pie did not set properly for me. No idea how I could have messed up something so easy but it was quite a mess. Threw it in the freezer to try and help matters but that did nothing. Still tasted good though.
Fun recipe to build fun in the kitchen with my daughter. She is seeming to be a natural!

Love it!! I will definitely make this again. I used a 9 1/2 inch pie plate so I'll probably double the filling next time. Instead of buying a graham cracker crust I made one. Super good and super easy.
Yummy. I drained the juice from the mashed strawberries before adding to mixture because someone commented that it was a little runny. Turned out perfect!
Perfect summer dessert! I used prepared shortbread crust just because that's what I had on hand!. Will make again.
This was a hit. You don't need to bother buying a store bought graham cracker crust when the Graham Cracker Crust I on this site is perfect for this, which is what I used.
Best strawberry pie recipe and so simple to make. I made mine with a golden oreo crust
My coworkers and I gobbled this right up.

Awesome recipe and so refreshing. I loved it. I did not use the graham cracker crust as I hate graham crackers. I used the Oreo cookie pie crust instead. I use the Oreo cookie pie crust when ever I make cream pies. It is the best. I make my own pie crust when I make cooked pies - or pies that have to be cooked with the crust.
Thank you for this recipe. I lost my recipe and have made this for years

I have made this four times in the past 3 weeks for different occasions and everybody has loved it! They all wanted the recipe. My only change was that I put it in an Oreo crust, and personally, I think it makes for an even tastier pie! My husband says it's a definite "keeper". Thanks for a great recipe!
Delicious pie! A must have for the kids in the summer.
Mine came out a little runny...but my guests raved about the flavor. Very delicious!

Best strawberry pie I've ever eaten! It was so simple to put together and I used a nilla wafer pie crust. DELISH!!You can sub pre-made whipped topping if you don't want to make the whipped cream, but honestly why would you? It took 5 minutes to make the whipped cream and tasted 10 times better. YUM YUM!
This pie was amazing...I made it with an Oreo Cookie crust....so tasty!!!!
Everyone asked for seconds when I made this pie. It was amazing. I followed the directions as they are listed above and will be using this easy, lovely recipe again and again!
Delicious!
YUM!!!!! Guilt free healthy dessert! I subbed the 1/4 cup sugar for maple syrup and eliminated the sugar in the whipped cream and it was heavenly! My whole family loved it!

Great recipe with whole food ingredients. It's perfect recipe for substitutions for those with allergies. I used vegan cream cheese and whipped coconut cream. I separated and whipped the cream from a can of Thai Kitchen's coconut milk. And, any brown rice flour and ground almond recipe will do for the crust. We all loved it.

Great recipe with whole food ingredients. It's perfect recipe for substitutions for those with allergies. I used vegan cream cheese and whipped coconut cream. I separated and whipped the cream from a can of Thai Kitchen's coconut milk. And, any brown rice flour and ground almond recipe will do for the crust. We all loved it.
